> It also sucks knowing that if U do good w/ certain champs, it's gonna make 9 other people more inclined to ban him/her in their next game.

I don't think so. If I get obliterated by a god tier Tryndamere I won't ban him next game, because it's probably losing my ban: there is a very little chance you will get matched against another god tier Tryndamere again. Yes, it sucks the time when it happens, but those 99 times it didn't, you realize it'd be a waste of a ban.

Okay, Melvin.

There's that thing you're doing. I think U'd call it "thinking." Yeah. Stop it. You'll win more games.

I'll use this post to extrapolate on something else. If there's a champion that someone wants to play that you _don't_ want to play with, why not just **type in chat** saying so, and **explaining why**? Sure, depending on how you go about this, you may come across as other negative traits or it could help teammates understand your thought-process and led to a better comp, but it's better than just passive aggressively outright banning the player's pick and possibly putting people on tilt before the game even starts. 

Better yet, during the process of writing said reason, it may become apparent that your argument is extremely conditional, pointless, and/or dumb compared to just banning a broken champion; and the whole issue can be averted.
Or you could choose to not limit yourself to only being able to play a single champion. That's an idea.
And what about high elo one tricks such as BoxBox? You don't see their teammates banning their one champ.

Boxbox is actually good enough with riven to warrant not banning him out though.

I personally don't ban because I don't want someone to play something. It's petty and I have better things to do with my bans to help the success of my team. But if you're going to be a one-trick pony, it'd be more realistic to pick a champion who can fill multiple roles.

I personally would like to be a one-trick pony with kayle, who can theoretically play all five roles this season. Even if she falls behind her ult still makes her valuable to the team to protect the people actually doing the work.
You don't pick a champion. The champion picks you.

Even if they intended to use the Champion to the point they showed it in Pick Intent time area, you still have the right to ban the Champ. Especially if you simply don't want to have that Champion on your team, or perhaps thinking that an opposing Champ will choose that Champ before your teammate can. I've banned Ezreal so many times when my teammates chose him, because they were lower than me in Pick Order and I was worried about having to go against Blue Ezreal.
It's also a good idea if your ally is choosing to go in a lane/Jg with a Champ that doesn't belong there. If you don't want Yasuo to go ADC, ban Yasuo and not only do you prevent them from fucking everything up but it also prevents your opponents from using him.

For this whole ordeal I will say unless you state otherwise it really is fair game. Especially if you are trying to use champions that are regularly ban and you aren't first picked I rather take the change of banning the champion all together since there is a high chance the enemy team will get said champions.

But I'm not against people who claim their pick intent says so in chat, and yet people will ban when it's not even a champion who is highly picked for bans.
